column4: I want to combine a jpeg and an mp3. I have done a bunch of searching and checked the intimidating help for ffmpeg and still don't have a working 1 liner for that task.
ive done the jpeg before do you have a sequence of jpegs or a single one?
the first step then is to create an input file for the frames. calculate fps*length and do "for f in `seq 1 prod`; do echo "filename">>frames.txt"; done
ok I follow you so far, I had a equivalent function worked out
and then it is something like ffmpeg -i @frames.txt -r fps -i audio.mp3 output.mp4
mencoder (apt-get install mplayer) is a bit less finiky than ffmpeg
I'm not attached to ffmpeg, just need a scriptable solution.
so your frames.txt is a file with 1 line for each frame where each line is the filename of the frame, correct
i believe so (never done it that way but I saw someone suggest that)
ahh, just trying to work out the input file you're using in the ffmpeg command
unless I am confusing with mencoder (which is entirely possible) you could try just doing ffmpeg -i image.jpeg -i audio.mp3
when I do that I get a 1 frame video that's very short.
i know that ffmpeg -i image%04d.jpeg will work
it defaults to a duration of .04 seconds though. this is where the documentation starts to fail hard. :/
you could make a bunch of symlinks in a script
